physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate dropped to 40-50 bpm during exposure therapy.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. A fainted at the sight of blood for many years; she also experienced a drop in heart rate during exposure therapy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, Ms. A experienced fainting and significant bradycardia when exposed to blood-injury cues. However, her reactions improved with therapy, and she gradually became able to cope with blood-injury situations without fainting.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Heart rate increased to 185 bpm during descent, then dropped to 60 bpm upon landing.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Syncope during exposure to blood or injury stimuli.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial fainting and bradycardia upon exposure to blood stimuli reduced with exposure therapy, leading to improvements in coping with blood-injury situations.
